#summary Rendering notes for the CheckBoxList control
#labels documentation,CheckBoxList

= Introduction =

Adapted content for the `CheckBoxList` control is available through the `CheckBoxListAdapter` or the `CssCheckBoxList` control.


= HTML Rendering =

The `CheckBoxList` is rendered as an unordered list (`UL`), with each checkbox included in a  list item (`LI`). Checkboxes are rendered as `input` tags of type `checkbox`. Each checkbox has a corresponding `label` tag unless there is no text or value assigned to the corresponding `ListItem`.

== Sample Markup ==

ASP.Net Code:
{{{
<asp:CheckBoxList ID="CheckBoxList1" runat="server">
	<asp:ListItem Value="0" Text="Normal" />
	<asp:ListItem Value="1" Text="Disabled" Enabled="false" />
	<asp:ListItem Value="2" Text="Selected" Selected="True" />
	<asp:ListItem Value="NoText" />
	<asp:ListItem />
</asp:CheckBoxList>
}}}

Control Adapter markup:
{{{
<ul class="checkBoxList vertical" id="adaptedCheckBoxList">
	<li><input id="adaptedCheckBoxList_0" name="adaptedCheckBoxList$0" type="checkbox" value="0" /><label for="adaptedCheckBoxList_0">Normal</label></li>
	<li class="disabled"><input id="adaptedCheckBoxList_1" name="adaptedCheckBoxList$1" type="checkbox" disabled="disabled" value="1" /><label for="adaptedCheckBoxList_1">Disabled</label></li>
	<li><input id="adaptedCheckBoxList_2" name="adaptedCheckBoxList$2" type="checkbox" checked="checked" value="2" /><label for="adaptedCheckBoxList_2">Selected</label></li>
	<li><input id="adaptedCheckBoxList_3" name="adaptedCheckBoxList$3" type="checkbox" value="NoText" /><label for="adaptedCheckBoxList_3">NoText</label></li>
	<li><input id="adaptedCheckBoxList_4" name="adaptedCheckBoxList$4" type="checkbox" value="" /></li>
</ul>
}}}


= Configuration =

Configuration options include the following:

|| `CssClass` || The class applied to the `ul` element. ||
|| `DisabledCssClass` || If the control, or a list item in the control, is disabled, this class is applied to the `li` element. ||

A sample configuration follows.

{{{
<CheckBoxList cssClass="checkBoxList" 
	  disabledCssClass="disabled" />
}}}


= Implementation Notes =

== CheckBoxList Properties ==

The following table outlines those properties of the `CheckBoxList` control that are implemented in the `CheckBoxListAdapter` control. Properties not listed are not supported or implemented.

|| *Property* || *Implementation* ||
|| `ClientID` || Used as the unordered list's `id` attribute. ||
|| `CssClass` || When not null or empty, it is added to the unordered list's `class` list. ||
|| `Enabled` || When set to `false` and the default `DisabledCssClass` is specified, this class is added to the unordered list's and each list item's `class` list. ||
|| `Items` || All items in the control are rendered. Items which are disabled have the default `DisabledCssClass` applied to the appropriate list item element. ||
|| `RepeatDirection` || A lower-case string representation of `RepeatDirection` (i.e. `horizontal` or `vertical` is added as a CSS class in the unordered list's `class` list. ||
|| `TextAlign` || Specifies placement of the HTML `label` tag before or after the `input` checkbox. ||


== ListItem Properties Supported ==

The following table outlines those properties of the `CheckBoxList` control's `Items` collection that are implemented in the `CheckBoxListAdapter` control. Properties not listed are not supported or implemented.

|| *Property* || *Implementation* ||
|| `Enabled` || When disabled, the default `DisabledCssClass` is applied to the list item. ||
|| `Text` || Used as the text of the `label` tag. If this is not used, the `Value` property is used. If neither are used, the label is not rendered. ||
|| `Value` || Used as the checkbox's `value` attribute. Note that this is not added in standard ASP.Net markup. ||
